verses.verse: Now it happened in the days<WH3117> of Ahasuerus<WH325> (this is Ahasuerus<WH325> who reigned<WH4427> from India<WH1912> even to Ethiopia,<WH3568> over one hundred<WH3967> twenty<WH6242> - seven<WH7651> provinces<WH4082>),

in the third<WH7969> year<WH8141> of his reign,<WH4427> he made<WH6213> a feast<WH4960> for all his princes<WH8269> and his servants;<WH5650> the power<WH2428> of Persia<WH6539> and Media,<WH4074> the nobles<WH6579> and princes<WH8269> of the provinces,<WH4082> being before him.<WH6440>

When these days<WH3117> were fulfilled,<WH4390> the king<WH4428> made<WH6213> a seven<WH7651> day<WH3117> feast<WH4960> for all the people<WH5971> who were present<WH4672> in Shushan<WH7800> the palace,<WH1002> both great<WH1419> and small,<WH6996> in the court<WH2691> of the garden<WH1594> of the king<WH4428>'s palace.<WH1055>

There were hangings of white,<WH2353> green,<WH3768> and blue<WH8504> material,<WH270> fastened with cords<WH2256> of fine linen<WH948> and purple<WH713> to silver<WH3701> rings<WH1550> and marble<WH8336> pillars.<WH5982> The couches<WH4296> were of gold<WH2091> and silver,<WH3701> on a pavement<WH7531> of red,<WH923> white,<WH1858> yellow,<WH8504> and black<WH5508> marble.<WH8336>

They gave them drinks<WH8248> in golden<WH2091> vessels<WH3627> of various<WH8138> kinds,<WH3627> including royal<WH4438> wine<WH3196> in abundance,<WH7227> according to the bounty<WH3027> of the king.<WH4428>

In accordance with the law,<WH1881> the drinking<WH8360> was not compulsory;<WH597> for so the king<WH4428> had instructed<WH3245> all the officials<WH7227> of his house,<WH1004> that they should do<WH6213> according to every man<WH376>'s pleasure.<WH7522>
Also Vashti<WH2060> the queen<WH4436> made<WH6213> a feast<WH4960> for the women<WH802> in the royal<WH4438> house<WH1004> which belonged to King<WH4428> Ahasuerus.<WH325>

On the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> when the heart<WH3820> of the king<WH4428> was merry<WH2896> with wine,<WH3196> he commanded<WH559> Mehuman,<WH4104> Biztha,<WH968> Harbona,<WH2726> Bigtha,<WH903> and Abagtha,<WH5> Zethar,<WH2242> and Carcass,<WH3752> the seven<WH7651> eunuchs<WH5631> who served<WH8334> in the presence<WH6440> of Ahasuerus<WH325> the king,<WH4428>

But the queen<WH4436> Vashti<WH2060> refused<WH3985> to come<WH935> at the king<WH4428>'s commandment<WH1697> by<WH3027> the eunuchs.<WH5631> Therefore the king<WH4428> was very<WH3966> angry,<WH7107> and his anger<WH2534> burned in him.<WH1197>

Then the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to the wise men,<WH2450> who knew<WH3045> the times,<WH6256> (for it was the king<WH4428>'s custom<WH1697> to consult<WH6440> those who knew<WH3045> law<WH1881> and judgment;<WH1779>

and the next<WH7138> to him were Carshena,<WH3771> Shethar,<WH8369> Admatha,<WH133> Tarshish,<WH8659> Meres,<WH4825> Marsena,<WH4826> and Memucan,<WH4462> the seven<WH7651> princes<WH8269> of Persia<WH6539> and Media,<WH4074> who saw<WH7200> the king<WH4428>'s face,<WH6440> and sat<WH3427> first<WH7223> in the kingdom<WH4438>),

"What shall we do<WH6213> to the queen<WH4436> Vashti<WH2060> according to law,<WH1881> because she has not done<WH6213> the bidding<WH3982> of the King<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325> by<WH3027> the eunuchs?<WH5631>"

Memucan<WH4462> answered<WH559> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428> and the princes,<WH8269> "Vashti<WH2060> the queen<WH4436> has not done wrong<WH5753> to just the king,<WH4428> but also to all the princes,<WH8269> and to all the people<WH5971> who are in all the provinces<WH4082> of the King<WH4428> Ahasuerus.<WH325>

For this deed<WH1697> of the queen<WH4436> will become known<WH3318> to all women,<WH802> causing them to show<WH5869> contempt<WH959> for their husbands,<WH1167> when it is reported,<WH559> <WH4428> 'King Ahasuerus<WH325> commanded<WH559> Vashti<WH2060> the queen<WH4436> to be brought in<WH935> before<WH6440> him,<WH935> but she didn't come.'

Today,<WH3117> the princesses<WH8282> of Persia<WH6539> and Media<WH4074> who have heard<WH8085> of the queen<WH4436>'s deed<WH1697> will tell<WH559> all the king<WH4428>'s princes.<WH8269> This will cause much<WH1767> contempt<WH963> and wrath.<WH7110>

"If it please<WH2895> the king,<WH4428> let a royal<WH4438> commandment<WH1697> go<WH3318> from him,<WH6440> and let it be written<WH3789> among the laws<WH1881> of the Persians<WH6539> and the Medes,<WH4074> so that it cannot be altered,<WH5674> that Vashti<WH2060> may never again come<WH935> before<WH6440> King<WH4428> Ahasuerus;<WH325> and let the king<WH4428> give<WH5414> her royal estate<WH4438> to another<WH7468> who is better than she.<WH2896>

When the king<WH4428>'s decree<WH6599> which he shall make<WH6213> is published<WH8085> throughout all his kingdom<WH4438> (for it is great<WH7227>), all the wives<WH802> will give<WH5414> their husbands<WH1167> honor,<WH3366> both great<WH1419> and small.<WH6996>"
This advice<WH1697> pleased<WH3190> the king<WH4428> and the princes,<WH8269> and the king<WH4428> did<WH6213> according to the word<WH1697> of Memucan:<WH4462>

for he sent<WH7971> letters<WH5612> into all the king<WH4428>'s provinces,<WH4082> into every province<WH4082> according to its writing,<WH3791> and to every people<WH5971> in their language,<WH3956> that every man<WH376> should rule<WH8323> his own house,<WH1004> speaking<WH1696> in the language<WH3956> of his own people.<WH5971>
